com.tomtom.speedtools.testutils

Class PrivateAccessHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tomtom.speedtools.testutils.PrivateAccessHelper

  • public final class PrivateAccessHelper
extends Object
    The static methods provided by this class are to be used to access private or private static methods of classes under test. Note that you should think twice before testing private methods! Prefer to test private methods via non-private methods of their class. Also, think about whether those private methods wouldn't be better suited to be part of a new class as non-privates, which can then be unit tested as usual. However, if the private methods to test are logically part of their current class and factoring them out into a separate class would spread logic over two classes and hence reduce cohesiveness, then you may consider testing them with the help of the functionality provided here. Care must be applied if your test catches overly broad exceptions, e.g. by using @Test(expected = Throwable.class). If the class under test is refactored, and the method name or signature is not adapted in the test, then this may go undetected, because the helper methods in this class will throw a PrivateAccessFailure in case the target method could not be invoked. However, if your test expects a sub-type of Throwable, then the test will fail. The helper methods explicitly throw PrivateAccessFailure which is a direct sub-type of Throwable instead of a sub-type of one of the less generic exception types such that in case of a non-existent target method, refactoring errors can only go undetected if the test is expecting the too broad exception Throwable.

    • Method Detail

      • invokePrivateStaticMethod

        public static <T> Object invokePrivateStaticMethod(@Nonnull
                                                   Class<T> clazz,
                                                   @Nonnull
                                                   String methodName,
                                                   @Nonnull
                                                   Class<?>[] argumentTypes,
                                                   @Nullable
                                                   Object... argumentObjects)
                                            throws Throwable
        Invokes a private static method on the given clazz and returns its return value. Any exception the invoked method throws is re-thrown. Note that exceptions are not wrapped in a InvocationTargetException as they would be when calling Method.invoke(Object, Object...) directly, instead they are unwrapped first (using Throwable.getCause() and then rethrown. This way, exceptions can be asserted as usual in a unit test. Note that if the target method does not exist, an exception of type PrivateAccessFailure will be thrown. This exception extends the most generic type of exceptions, Throwable, which is chosen so that refactoring errors have the biggest chance of being detected as a failing test (unless the test expects a Throwable itself).
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the class on which to invoke the method.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class on which to invoke the method.
        methodName - The name of the method to invoke.
        argumentTypes - The types of the arguments the given method takes (in same order as in target method signature).
        argumentObjects - The parameters to the method to invoke.
        Returns:
        Returns the value of the invoked method.
        Throws:
        Throwable - Throws any exception the invoked method threw, or a PrivateAccessFailure in case the target method could not be invoked (method does not exist, method has different signature, security manager forbids access, etc.).

      • invokePrivateMethod

        public static <T> Object invokePrivateMethod(@Nonnull
                                             T instance,
                                             @Nonnull
                                             String methodName,
                                             @Nonnull
                                             Class<?>[] argumentTypes,
                                             @Nullable
                                             Object... argumentObjects)
                                      throws Throwable
        Invokes a private method on the given instance and returns its return value. The type used to invoke the private method on is the runtime type of instance. If you want to invoke the private method of a different class (i.e. a super-type of instance), use invokePrivateMethod(Class, Object, String, Class[], Object...) instead and specify the type explicitly. Any exception the invoked method throws is re-thrown. Note that exceptions are not wrapped in a InvocationTargetException as they would be when calling Method.invoke(Object, Object...) directly, instead they are unwrapped first (using Throwable.getCause() and then rethrown. This way, exceptions can be asserted as usual in a unit test. Note that if the target method does not exist, an exception of type PrivateAccessFailure will be thrown. This exception extends the most generic type of exceptions, Throwable, which is chosen so that refactoring errors have the biggest chance of being detected as a failing test (unless the test expects a Throwable itself).
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the class on which to invoke the method.
        Parameters:
        instance - The instance on which to invoke the method.
        methodName - The name of the method to invoke.
        argumentTypes - The types of the arguments the given method takes (in same order as in target method signature).
        argumentObjects - The parameters to the method to invoke.
        Returns:
        Returns the value of the invoked method.
        Throws:
        Throwable - Throws any exception the invoked method threw, or a PrivateAccessFailure in case the target method could not be invoked (method does not exist, method has different signature, security manager forbids access, etc.).

      • invokePrivateMethod

        public static <T,U extends T> Object invokePrivateMethod(@Nonnull
                                                         Class<T> clazz,
                                                         @Nullable
                                                         U instance,
                                                         @Nonnull
                                                         String methodName,
                                                         @Nonnull
                                                         Class<?>[] argumentTypes,
                                                         @Nullable
                                                         Object... argumentObjects)
                                                  throws Throwable
        Invokes a private method on the given instance using type clazz for method lookup, and returns its return value. Use this method if you want to invoke a method on a different type than the runtime type of instance. Otherwise, use invokePrivateMethod(Object, String, Class[], Object...) instead. Any exception the invoked method throws is re-thrown. Note that exceptions are not wrapped in a InvocationTargetException as they would be when calling Method.invoke(Object, Object...) directly, instead they are unwrapped first (using Throwable.getCause() and then rethrown. This way, exceptions can be asserted as usual in a unit test. Note that if the target method does not exist, an exception of type PrivateAccessFailure will be thrown. This exception extends the most generic type of exceptions, Throwable, which is chosen so that refactoring errors have the biggest chance of being detected as a failing test (unless the test expects a Throwable itself).
        Type Parameters:
        T - Class.
        U - Instance class.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The class on which to lookup the method (must be of same type or super-type as instance.
        instance - The instance on which to invoke the method (must be of same type or sub-type as clazz.
        methodName - The name of the method to invoke.
        argumentTypes - The types of the arguments the given method takes (in same order as in target method signature).
        argumentObjects - The parameters to the method to invoke.
        Returns:
        Returns the value of the invoked method.
        Throws:
        Throwable - Throws any exception the invoked method threw, or a PrivateAccessFailure in case the target method could not be invoked (method does not exist, method has different signature, security manager forbids access, etc.).
